page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: Cottage Farm, Osliston, consists of 54 acres of grassland. It has been in our family since the late 1800's. At present I, Anne, and Eric Parkinson, son Andrew (14) and daughter Rachel (11) live here. My Grandfather, William Sessions, came here as a tenant farmer, then bought it later on. My father, George Sessions, youngest son of eleven children was born here in 1902, and attended Long Lane School and Church. 30 members of the Sessions family have attended Long Lane School between 1888 and 1985. During my father's life_time it was a mixed farm. He died here in 1974, whereupon we took over. We modernised the buildings and put up a cubicle shed, making it an intensive dairy unit, although milk is not as profitable since the introduction of quotas in 1984.
